pr_title: Issue #3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore si…

timeline.message: Issue #3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore single-line array

timeline.bodyText:
please add a new line
/**
 * Setter to control ...
 *
 * @param alwaysDemandTrailingComma ...
 */
also I wonder about instead of user's value, maybe restating whether to always check for a trailing comma
timeline.author: esilkensen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -143,6 +171,19 @@
      */
     public static final String MSG_KEY = "array.trailing.comma";
 
+    /**
+     * Control whether to always check for a trailing comma, even when an array is inline.
+     */
+    private boolean alwaysDemandTrailingComma;
+
+    /**
+     * Setter to control whether to always check for a trailing comma, even when an array is inline.
+     * @param alwaysDemandTrailingComma user's value

timeline.bodyText:
I wonder if it would be easier/harder to read if pulling out alwaysDemandTrailingComma, e.g.
&& (alwaysDemandTrailingComma ||
    (!TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(rcurly, previousSibling) &&
     !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(arrayInit, previousSibling)))
timeline.author: esilkensen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -164,8 +205,9 @@ public void visitToken(DetailAST arrayInit) {
         final DetailAST previousSibling = rcurly.getPreviousSibling();
 
         if (arrayInit.getChildCount() != 1
-                && !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(rcurly, previousSibling)
-                && !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(arrayInit, previousSibling)
+                && (alwaysDemandTrailingComma || !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(rcurly, previousSibling))
+                && (alwaysDemandTrailingComma
+                    || !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(arrayInit, previousSibling))

timeline.message: Issue #3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore single-line array
Issue #3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore single-line array

timeline.bodyText:
please add comment with config explanation (if other than default), e.g.
/* Config:
*  prop1 = true
* prop2 = false
*/
timeline.author: strkkk
strkkk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -132,6 +139,27 @@ * ,}; // no violation * * + *

To configure check to always validate trailing comma:

+ * 
+ * <module name="ArrayTrailingComma">
+ *   <property name="alwaysDemandTrailingComma" value="true"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * int[] a = new int[] {1, 2}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
+ * String[] b = new String[]{"foo", "bar",}; // ok
+ * int[] c = {1

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/ArrayTrailingCommaCheck.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/ArrayTrailingCommaCheck.java
index 936145002..78d969e36 100644
--- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/ArrayTrailingCommaCheck.java
+++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/ArrayTrailingCommaCheck.java

@@ -149,9 +149,6 @@ import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.TokenUtil;
  * <pre>
  * int[] a = new int[] {1, 2}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
  * String[] b = new String[]{"foo", "bar",}; // ok
- * int[] c = {1
- *  2 // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
- * };
  * int[] d = {
  * 1}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
  * int[] c = {

timeline.bodyText:
what is difference between this example and one in line 152?
also, field name 'c' is in use already
timeline.author: strkkk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -132,6 +139,27 @@ * ,}; // no violation * * + *

To configure check to always validate trailing comma:

+ * 
+ * <module name="ArrayTrailingComma">
+ *   <property name="alwaysDemandTrailingComma" value="true"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * int[] a = new int[] {1, 2}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
+ * String[] b = new String[]{"foo", "bar",}; // ok
+ * int[] c = {1
+ *  2 // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
+ * };
+ * int[] d = {
+ * 1}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
+ * int[] c = {
+ *     1,
+ *     2 // violation, array should contain trailing comma.

replies.bodyText:
Oh yeah, removed one of of them 👍
Thanks

timeline.message: Issue #3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore single-line array
Issue #3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore single-line array

timeline.bodyText:
please add examples with multidimensional arrays, and cases like
https://gaurav-punjabi.github.io/checkstyle/3201/lombok-ast/xref/Users/gauravpunjabi/checkstyle-contribution/checkstyle-tester/repositories/lombok-ast/test/resources/idempotency/C005_ArrayInitialization.java.html#L14

timeline.message: Issue #3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore single-line array
Issue #3201: Allow to configure if ArrayTrailingComma should ignore single-line array

timeline.bodyText: please copy whole code block from default and show how it become different vs default behavior.
timeline.author: romani
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -132,6 +139,24 @@ * ,}; // no violation * * + *

To configure check to always validate trailing comma:

+ * 
+ * <module name="ArrayTrailingComma">
+ *   <property name="alwaysDemandTrailingComma" value="true"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * int[] a = new int[] {1, 2}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/ArrayTrailingCommaCheck.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/ArrayTrailingCommaCheck.java index b022360ef..9821908fc 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/ArrayTrailingCommaCheck.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/ArrayTrailingCommaCheck.java @@ -147,14 +147,37 @@ import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.TokenUtil; * *

Example:

* 
- * int[] a = new int[] {1, 2}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
- * String[] b = new String[]{"foo", "bar",}; // ok
- * int[] d = {
- * 1}; // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
- * int[] c = {
- *     1,
- *     2 // violation, array should contain trailing comma.
- * };
+ * int[] numbers = {1, 2, 3}; // violation
+ * boolean[] bools = {
+ * true,
+ * true,
+ * false
+ * }; // violation
+ *
+ * String[][] text = {{},{},}; // OK
+ *
+ * double[][] decimals = {
+ * {0.5, 2.3, 1.1,},        //no violation
+ * {1.7, 1.9, 0.6},
+ * {0.8, 7.4, 6.5}
+ * }; // violation, previous line misses a comma
+ *
+ * char[] chars = {'a', 'b', 'c'  // violation
+ *   };
+ *
+ * String[] letters = {
+ *   "a", "b", "c"}; // violation
+ *
+ * int[] a1 = new int[]{
+ *   1,
+ *   2
+ *   ,
+ * }; // OK
+ *
+ * int[] a2 = new int[]{
+ *   1,
+ *   2
+ *   ,}; // OK
  *
* * @since 3.2
